com.snap2d

Class ThreadManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.ThreadManager

  • public final class ThreadManager
extends Object
    Manages standard and daemon thread pools for the Snap2D Engine.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

      • awaitTermination

        public boolean awaitTermination(long timeout)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Blocks the current thread until this ThreadManager's thread pool has fully shutdown.
        Parameters:
        timeout - time in milliseconds to timeout
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • reboot

        public void reboot()
        Recreates a new thread pool after the current one has been shutdown. Uses the current number of threads (or cached pool if n < 1) in the newly created pool. If the current thread pool has not been shutdown, forceShutdown() is called.

      • setThreadCount

        public void setThreadCount(int nthreads)
        Sets the size of the current thread pool for the ThreadManager class. This method calls shutdown() on the current thread pool object then instantiates a new ExecutorService using the same reference with the number of threads specified. Make sure to call this method either a) before launching any thread jobs or b) when you are sure the threads in the current pool can be shutdown.
        Parameters:
        nthreads - The number of threads in the new thread pool. If n < 1, a cached thread pool will be created.

      • getThreadCount

        public int getThreadCount()
        The number of threads in the current thread pool, or zero if the current pool is cached.
        Returns:
